cyclone.name: OPHELIA
cyclone.current_location: about 330 mi ESE of Charleston, SC and 325 mi S of Cape Hatteras, NC
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northwest toward the North Carolina coast, then expected to track inland across eastern NC, southeastern VA, and the Delmarva Peninsula
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: eastern North Carolina coast near Cape Lookout/Cape Fear area

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm Surge Watch from South Santee River SC to Surf City NC (just north of Wilmington)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Cape Fear NC to Fenwick Island DE (includes Wilmington/Cape Fear area)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeast and Mid-Atlantic coastline from South Carolina through New Jersey
weather_observation.wind: Sustained 35–45 mph winds with higher gusts expected from Friday night through Saturday evening
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–3 ft of inundation possible along the lower Cape Fear River and adjacent beaches
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches with localized amounts up to 7 inches could cause urban and small-stream flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; isolated tornadoes possible beginning Friday night
